segments.pli: 18. Samuddavagga
segments.en: 18. The Ocean

segments.pli: 230. Bāḷisikopamasutta
segments.en: 230. The Simile of the Fisherman

segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, bāḷisiko āmisagatabaḷisaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose a fisherman was to cast a baited hook into a deep lake.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro āmisacakkhu maccho gileyya.
segments.en: Seeing the bait, a fish would swallow it.

segments.pli: Evañhi so, bhikkhave, maccho gilitabaḷiso bāḷisikassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāḷisikassa.
segments.en: And so the fish that swallowed the hook would meet with tragedy and disaster, and the fisherman can do what he wants with it.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, chayime baḷisā lokasmiṃ anayāya sattānaṃ vadhāya pāṇinaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, there are these six hooks in the world that mean tragedy and slaughter for living creatures.

segments.pli: Katame cha?
segments.en: What six?

segments.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: There are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce, bhikkhu, abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them,

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilitabaḷiso, mārassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato … pe …
segments.en: they’re called a mendicant who has swallowed Māra’s hook. They’ve met with tragedy and disaster, and the Wicked One can do what he wants with them.

segments.pli: santi, bhikkhave, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe ….
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce, bhikkhu, abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them,

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilitabaḷiso mārassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato.
segments.en: they’re called a mendicant who has swallowed Māra’s hook. They’ve met with tragedy and disaster, and the Wicked One can do what he wants with them.

segments.pli: Santi ca, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: There are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce, bhikkhu, nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na gilitabaḷiso mārassa abhedi baḷisaṃ paribhedi baḷisaṃ na anayaṃ āpanno na byasanaṃ āpanno na yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato … pe ….
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them, they’re called a mendicant who hasn’t swallowed Māra’s hook. They’ve broken the hook, destroyed it. They haven’t met with tragedy and disaster, and the Wicked One cannot do what he wants with them.

segments.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe ….
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: Santi, bhikkhave, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na gilitabaḷiso mārassa abhedi baḷisaṃ paribhedi baḷisaṃ na anayaṃ āpanno na byasanaṃ āpanno na yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato”ti.
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them, they’re called a mendicant who hasn’t swallowed Māra’s hook. They’ve broken the hook, destroyed it. They haven’t met with tragedy and disaster, and the Wicked One cannot do what he wants with them.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.
